name: ContentType
comment: Representation of a content type. An instance of dart-io.ContentType is immutable.

TEXT.name: TEXT
TEXT.comment:
Content type for plain text using UTF-8 encoding.

text/plain; charset=utf-8

HTML.name: HTML
HTML.comment:
Content type for HTML using UTF-8 encoding.

text/html; charset=utf-8

JSON.name: JSON
JSON.comment:
Content type for JSON using UTF-8 encoding.

application/json; charset=utf-8

constructors.comment: Creates a new content type object setting the primary type and sub type. The charset and additional parameters can also be set using dart-io.ContentType.ContentType-.charset and dart-io.ContentType.ContentType-.parameters. If charset is passed and dart-io.ContentType.ContentType-.parameters contains charset as well the passed dart-io.ContentType.ContentType-.charset will override the value in parameters. Keys and values passed in parameters will be converted to lower case.

parse.name: parse
parse.comment:
Creates a new content type object from parsing a Content-Type header value. As primary type, sub type and parameter names and values are not case sensitive all these values will be converted to lower case. Parsing this string

text/html; charset=utf-8

will create a content type object with primary type text, sub type html and parameter charset with value utf-8.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides dart-io.ContentType.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

parameters.name: parameters
parameters.comment:
Gets the map of parameters.

This map cannot be modified. invoking any operation which would modify the map will throw dart-core.UnsupportedError.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and dart-io.ContentType.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the dart-io.ContentType.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment:
Returns the formatted string representation in the form:

value; parameter1=value1; parameter2=value2

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
dart-io.ContentType.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to dart-io.ContentType.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If dart-io.ContentType.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of dart-io.ContentType.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.
